subject: Home & DIY
title: When Your Home Talks to the Grid
description: A micro-lesson that makes When Your Home Talks to the Grid usable.

hook.text: Soon your dishwasher will run when power is cheapest, your car will charge on wind peaks, and your house will sell back.

buildup.text: Smart grid integration lets homes react to real-time energy prices. Flexible loads shift to off-peak on their own.

discovery.text: Demand response pays you to cut use during grid peaks. Your thermostat shifts 2Â°F for an hour and you earn credits.

twist.text: Vehicle-to-home tech lets your EV power the house in outages. A car battery holds 3-5 days of home energy.

climax.text: Homes become grid participantsâ€”consuming, storing, and selling energy. Delivery shifts from one-way to a marketplace.

punchline.text: Your home won't just use energyâ€”it'll trade it.

quiz.question: What is vehicle-to-home (V2H) technology?
options: Using an electric car's battery to power your house during outages
Charging your car at home instead of a public station
An app that routes your car to the cheapest nearby charger
